forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 44. West southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of Sunday unfold, Downtown San Francisco stands enveloped in a gentle embrace of serene cloud cover and soft breezes. With a low temperature hanging around a brisk 44 degrees, the city exudes a certain tranquility, yet whispers of a lingering coolness permeate the air. The panorama reveals a crisp clarity, although a hint of fog clings stubbornly to the fringes, lending a dreamy quality to the view, particularly by the water’s edge.

As the sun rises higher, it will cast warmth onto the streets, transforming the day into a mix of sunshine and lingering clouds. Expect a high near 54, subtly dipping as the day progresses. Wisps of wind, blowing from the west-northwest, may rustle the leaves and whisk away the morning haze, providing a refreshing touch to the atmosphere. For those venturing out, a light jacket will suffice against the cool air, and a scarf may be the ideal companion for added comfort. Consider a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, where the mist meets the iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate, or perhaps indulge in a quiet morning at a local café, savoring a warm cup while watching the city awaken—a modest yet beautiful way to greet the day.
